It's a love-hate relationship for this game. It's really fun to mess around with and the lore is amazing but the community and game itself can be toxic. Both killers and survivors think the other side is overpowered. Survivors having flashlights and stuff, and killers having noed. If you look past that it's a great game and really fun once you find the right people. Ranking system needs work though...

Fun and addicting. Satisfying to play both killer and survivor alike once you get the hang of the core game mechanics. If you are looking for a fun simple round based game that is not time consuming this is it.

Game is quite enjoyable with friends if you can actually play it. Unfortunately, trying to join a friend and finding a match will test your patience. Server crashes are extremely common and will give you a hard time. Try the game and if you have the same issues ask for a refund, if you don't it is definitely worth the price.

I played it on Xbox before getting a pc. Recommend everyone gives it a go with or without people to play with.

disclaimer: i dont play this game anymore, but still watch videos and streams. i used to play regularly with friends, but even then it grow more and more unberable.

I'm gonna be honest, this game has some major downsides to it:
1) hitboxes are still shit, just like 6 years ago and it seems like the devs accepted that and dont intend on fixing them anymore
2) the community is one of the most toxic ones I ever experienced and most likely among the worst ones in the entire internet  (and I stand behind this 100%)
3) matchmaking sucks. sometimes you get matched with red ranks (ranks 4-1) even though you are yellow or green rank (ranks 17-10)

BUT

1) this game can be hella fun with some friends or the right killer and perk build if you play solo
2) nice learning curve with every single killer having strengths and weaknesses and unique perks
3) no painful grinding of loadouts, you can farm bloodpoints with any character and use them on every character to unlock stuff
4) overall nice-looking  maps and thoughtful map design, you can see they put some effort in them on most maps although maps like haddonfield are still fairly unbalanced
5) many license dlc packs, such as as Stranger Things, Nightmare on Elm Street, Ghostface, Leatherface, Silent Hill and Halloween Franchise so there is someone to play for every desired playstyle both for killers and survivors

CONCLUSION

there are obvious weaknesses to this game if you look closely, but it remains a solid buy for its price although you can pay massive amounts of money for all the dlc content and you can still enjoy it regardless of its blatant flaws. especially if you are mentally stable and can handle  bad experiences, the game still has its moments so i dont completely recommend against it. however, be prepared for trolling, hackers and griefing teammates or tunneling killers because they themselves had bad rounds and want to take it out on you.

Every single time there's an update for this game it's 5 minutes to download it, 8 hours to install the update... and I mean it. And while the game is updating, feel free to do anything you want with your life EXCEPT using your computer for anything AT ALL, because Steam will monopolize your CPU and RAM in order to update this game. And the estimated time to finish? Well, it fluctuates more than the price of criptocurrency... It goes from 45 minutes to 23 hours in 5 minutes, then it goes to less than 10 minutes only to jump back to 2 hours after 8 minutes passed... It's amazing! I never enjoyed the game that much and it's a nightmare to update in order to even try to play it, so it's pretty hard to develop a taste for something so broken.
Idk why, but I love this game so much
Absolutely love this game, a blast to play with friends or solo.
DBD ist ein sehr geiles und Gutes Spiel, dennoch hat es viele Fehler und leider meist toxische und nervige Killer. Trotzdem spiele ich das spiel gerne mit meinen Freunden!
